Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: TEST PERIOD TYPE: This reference table describes a well test time pressure periodtype. For example hydrostatic, shutin, valve open or flowing.
Column Comment.6: PERIOD OBS NO: A unique identifier for each observation in the well test flow
Column Comment.7: FLUID TYPE: The type of fluid measured during the well test.
Column Comment.8: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.9: BASIC SEDIMENT INDICATOR: An indicator identifying that the kind of shake out isbasic sediment .
Column Comment.10: BLOW DESCRIPTION:. A description of the evidence observed at surface of the flowentering the subsurface string during a drill stem test. For example, good air blow..
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: GAS RISER DIAMETER: Gas riser diameter (inside) of the gas measuring device.
Column Comment.14: GAS RISER DIAMETER OUOM: Gas riser diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.15: MAXIMUM FLUID RATE: Maximum fluid rate for the specified period.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM FLUID RATE OUOM: Fluid rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: MAXIMUM FLUID RATE UOM: Unit of measure for maximum fluid rate. Multiplestorage units maybe required.
Column Comment.18: MAXIMUM SURFACE PRESSURE: Maximum surface pressure is the highestpressure reading at surface.
Column Comment.19: MAXIMUM SURFACE PRESSURE OUOM: Maximum surface pressure original unitof measure.
Column Comment.20: MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUE: The various flow measurement techniques used forwell tests. For example orifice meter, separator, estimated.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.23: SHAKEOUT PERCENTAGE: Value for the basic sediment or basic sediment andwater expressed to the nearest percent. This is applicable to the Permian Basin only.
Column Comment.24: TTS TIME ELAPSED: The elapsed time it took for the material to reach the surface.
Column Comment.25: TTS TIME ELAPSED OUOM: Time to surface original unit of measure.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
